content: colwith mittens show me what you made #colwithmittens ig @knit off a pair of cosy cabled mitts with the option to make them convertible named after colwith force near skelwith in the lake district the flowing cables remind me of the huge waterfalls and smaller trickling streams i spent a decent amount of my childhood in a little cottage up in little langdale and it s one of my favourite areas a trundle through the wood never fails to cheer me up the colwith mittens are knit in dk yarn with 3 5mm and 3 75mm needles however you prefer to knit small circumferences i used irunthisknit s ig @irunthisknit hand-dyed yarn which was a delight but the pattern will work with any dk yarn thanks to the squishy yarn they knit up quickly and easily the cable pattern is simple and repetitive perfect for distracted knitting there are 4 sizes to choose from depending on if you prefer a closer or looser fit needles and notions 3 50mm dpns or preferred method of small circumference knitting or needles required to meet gauge 3 75mm dpns or preferred method of small circumference knitting or needles required to meet gauge cable needle 3 75mm or smaller stitch marker tapestry needle = scissors scrap yarn yarn + gauge dk yarn full mitten - 100/136/160/194 yds convertible mitten - 148/190/210/244 yds 6sts and 7 row =1 x1 in stockinette stitch sizing with larger needles size 1 - 3 1/2 wide 9 1/2 long size 2 - 4 wide 10 long abbreviations size 3 - 4 1/2 wide 11 long bor - beginning of round size 4 - 5 wide 12 5 long pm - place marker m1 - make 1 stitch use your preferred method i use the right needle to pick up the right hand leg of the stitch below the first stitch on the left needle place it on the left needle and knit it k1tbl - knit the next stitch though the back loop ktbl has been given a colour instead of a symbol in order to make the chart easier to read k2tog - knit two together knit the next stitches together ssk slip 1 stitch knitwise slip 1 stich purlwise knit the two together c6rtbl - cable 6 right through the back loop slip 3 stitches to a cable needle and hold in front knit the next 3 stitches from the left needle through the back loop knit the 3 stitches from the cable needle through the back loop c6ltbl - cable 6 left through the back loop slip 3 stitches to a cable needle and hold in the back knit the next three stitches from the left needle through the back loop knit the 3 stitches from the cable needle through the back loop c3rtbl - cable 3 right through the back loop slip the next 2 stitches to a cable needle and hold in front knit the next stich from the left needle through the back
